name: OGC Collections
abstract: The distribution of a geospatial dataset in an API is organized into one or more collections of data. How the data is split into collections in a distribution depends on the intended use of the data. Two common approaches for organizing the data are: by semantic type and by spatial clustering. The OGC Collections JSON resource provides information about and access to the data in each collection of the distribution.

name: OGC Collection
abstract: An OGC Collection resource is a JSON object that provides information about and access to a set of geospatial resources, through links to API endpoints and/or files online. It is most commonly used to describe geospatial datasets, but can be used for collections of anything geospatial.

name: Extent
abstract: This JSON object provides information about the spatial and temporal extent of a resource. A typical resource type is a collection and the object describes the extent of all items in the collection.

name: Bounding Box
abstract: The bounding box JSON object describes a simple spatial extent of a resource. For OGC API’s this could be a feature, a feature collection or a dataset, but it can be used in any JSON resource that wants to communicate its rough location. The extent is simple in that the bounding box does not describe the precise location and shape of the resource, but provides an axis-aligned approximation of the spatial extent that can be used as an initial test whether two resources are potentially intersecting each other.

name: bbox-crs
abstract: The bbox-crs query parameter can be used to assert the coordinate reference system that is used for the coordinate values of the bbox parameter.

name: bbox
abstract: The bbox query parameter provides a simple mechanism for filtering resources based on their location. It selects all resources that intersect a rectangle (map view) or box (including height information).

name: crs
abstract: The crs query parameter can be used to request the coordinate reference system to use for any coordinates included in the response.

name: content-crs
abstract: Because of the inconsistent provision of coordinate reference system (CRS) metadata in geospatial encodings and the continued confusion caused by the axis order of coordinates, this header provides a mechanism for a server to clearly and unambiguously assert the CRS being used in a response document independent of the requested output format.

name: Feature
abstract: A feature. Every feature is a sub-resource of an OGC Collection.

name: Features
abstract: The features in an OGC Collection. This resource supports spatial filtering with the bbox parameter, temporal filtering with the datetime parameter.

name: Position Query
abstract: The Position Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, at the position specified by WKT spatiotemporal coordinates.

name: Radius Query
abstract: The Radius Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, within the radius from a given point specified by WKT spatiotemporal coordinates.

name: Area Query
abstract: The Area Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, within the area specified by WKT spatiotemporal coordinates.

name: Cube Query
abstract: The Cube Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, within the specified bounding box and for the specified vertical coordinates.

name: Trajectory Query
abstract: The Trajectory Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, along a trajectory specified by WKT spatiotemporal coordinates.

name: Corridor Query
abstract: The Corridor Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, around a trajectory specified by WKT spatiotemporal coordinates.

name: Item Query
abstract: The Item Query supports the retrieval of features from a collection, specified by an identifier.

name: Locations Query
abstract: The Locations Query supports the retrieval of data from a collection, specified by a named location.

name: Data Queries
abstract: The Data Queries supports the definition of custom queries for the retrieval of data from a collection, specified by spatiotemporal coordinates.

name: Parameter Names
abstract: The Parameter Names object supports the definition of data properties for the retrieval of data from a collection.

name: OGC Conformance Declaration
abstract: An OGC Conformance Declaration is a JSON object that lists the conformance classes from standards or community specifications, identified by a URI, that the API conforms to.

name: Instant
abstract: Temporal instants are either a date or timestamp in the Gregorian calendar as specified by RFC 3339. See the syntax of full-date and date-time in section 5.6.

name: Interval
abstract: Temporal intervals are described by the start and end instants. Both start and end instants are included in the interval.

name: OGC API Landing Page
abstract: The OGC API Landing Page provides links to important resources in the API, as a JSON object. All other OGC API resources are sub-resources of this resource. The landing page will typically also include essential metadata about the API, for example, a title and a description.

name: Link
abstract: Web linking according to RFC 8288 is used to express relationships between resources. The JSON object representation of links described here is used consistently in OGC API’s.

name: datetime
abstract: The datetime query parameter provides a simple mechanism for filtering resources based on their temporal extent. It selects all resources that intersect an temporal instant or interval.

name: limit
abstract: The limit query parameter provides a mechanism for a client to limit the maximum number of items in a response from an API resource that is some kind of a collection of items.

name: OGC Dataset Collection
abstract: An OGC Dataset Collection resource is a JSON object that provides information about and access to a geospatial dataset, such as a feature collection or a multi-dimensional coverage, through links to API endpoints and/or files online. It extends the OGC Collection with additional fields that help describe a dataset, providing the key metadata to enable the crawling and search of geospatial datasets
